content.question: Let <math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be the region in the first quadrant bounded on the right by the graph of <math alttext="y equals, three halves x, minus 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, above by the horizontal line <math alttext="y equals 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, and on the left by the vertical line <math alttext="x equals 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which of the following gives the volume of the solid generated when region <math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is revolved about the vertical line <math alttext="x equals 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="pi times the integral from, 2 to 4, of, open parenthesis, open parenthesis, the fraction with numerator 2 y, plus 6, and denominator 3, close parenthesis, minus 2, close parenthesis, squared, d y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mi>π</mi><mstyle><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msubsup><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>y</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>6</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>

<math alttext="pi times the integral from, 0 to 3, of, open parenthesis, open parenthesis, the fraction with numerator 2 y, plus 6, and denominator 3, close parenthesis, minus 2, close parenthesis, squared, d y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mi>π</mi><mstyle><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msubsup><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>y</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>6</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>

<math alttext="pi times the integral from, 2 to 4, of, open parenthesis, 3 minus, open parenthesis, three halves x, minus 3, close parenthesis, close parenthesis, squared, d x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>π</mi><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>−</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>

<math alttext="pi times the integral from, 0 to 3, of, open parenthesis, open parenthesis, the fraction with numerator 2 y, plus 6, and denominator 3, close parenthesis, squared, minus 2 squared, close parenthesis, d y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mi>π</mi><mstyle><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mo>(</mo><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>y</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>6</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><msup><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="pi times the integral from, 0 to 3, of, open parenthesis, open parenthesis, the fraction with numerator 2 y, plus 6, and denominator 3, close parenthesis, minus 2, close parenthesis, squared, d y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mi>π</mi><mstyle><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msubsup><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>y</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>6</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>

topic.text: 8.10: Volume with Disc Method - Revolving Around Other Axes

skill.text: Skill 2.D: Identify how mathematical characteristics or properties of functions are related in different representations.
